page.title: 07Changing times.
page.content: I am a grandmother.I started school 56 years ago aged 5 and left at 14.There were 4 classrooms heated by a free standing coke fire.We could buy Horlicks tablets to suck or make into a hot drink.I went home for lunch other children brought packed lunches.At first we wrote on slate boards with chalk.We danced round a Maypole to a man playing a fiddle.We grew fruit and vegetables which we put on a barrow and sold round the houses for school funds.On Sports Day we went to Duridge Bay on straw covered flat carts drawn by horses.We took a mug and were given tea and a bag of buns.Money was given as prizes.If you won a sixpenny or threepenny piece(old currency)you felt very rich because your pocket money was only a penny a week.I enjoyed Sports Day very much.
